author: Staff Reporter
text:
Organs retrieved from a brain dead patient were transported from a private hospital in Salem to two private hospitals in Coimbatore during the wee hours of Thursday.

The ambulance covered a distance of more than 150 km to the hospitals here in 100 minutes to enable speedy transplant to three patients.

The victim, S. Devendran (22) of Villupuram district, completed high school and was trying for a job abroad.

Around 11.30 p.m. on Sunday, he was riding a bike on Cuddalore - Kallakurichi Bypass Road when he bumped into a speed breaker, and suffered a severe head injury.

He was admitted in Vinayaka Mission Hospital, where he did not respond to treatment over the next two days before going into a coma state on Tuesday.

He was declared brain-dead the following day. Devendran’s parents agreed to donate his organs and a team of surgeons from PSG Hospital went to Salem on Wednesday.

In a surgery that went on for a little less than four hours from 10 p.m. on that day, his liver, kidneys and eyes were retrieved.

The ambulance started from Salem at 2.05 a.m. on Thursday and reached PSG Hospital where a liver and kidney were handed over. Another kidney was taken to Kovai Medical Center and Hospital.

The eyes were donated to a hospital in Salem.
title: Organs of brain dead youth save three lives
